The Emperor noticed Countess Bezúkhova and honored her with a dance.
Borís Drubetskóy had left his wife in Moscow.
Borís Drubetskóy was for the present en garçon.
Borís Drubetskóy was not an aide-de-camp.

Borís Drubetskóy was a rich man who had risen to high honors.
Borís Drubetskóy no longer sought patronage.
Borís Drubetskóy stood on an equal footing with the highest of his own age.
Borís Drubetskóy was meeting Hélène in Vílna after not having seen her for a long time.

The Emperor stood in the doorway.

The Emperor nodded slightly to the Polish lady and turned to Adjutant General Balashëv.
A look of amazement appeared on the Emperor’s face before Adjutant General Balashëv began to speak.
The Emperor took Adjutant General Balashëv by the arm.
The Emperor crossed the room with Adjutant General Balashëv.
The Emperor unconsciously cleared a path seven yards wide as people on both sides made way.

Arakchéev looked at the Emperor from under his brow.
Arakchéev sniffed with his red nose.

Arakchéev did not notice the Emperor and Adjutant General Balashëv.

Arakchéev glancing wrathfully around.
Arakchéev followed some twenty paces behind the Emperor and Adjutant General Balashëv.

Borís wanted to find out the news before others.

Borís stood still at the door.

Borís closed his eyes and slightly bowed his head.
The Emperor re-entered the ballroom.
